page.title: 10Pimperne Parish Council.
page.content: WE interviewed Mr F.Waterman,Chairman of Pimperne Parish Council.He told us in the Parish Council there are seven people who live or have business interests in Pimperne.They have to be over 18 to be elected onto the Council.There is an election every 4 years.The Parish Council deals with things like checking the swings and slides for us and they repair all sorts of things.They plant trees.All this cost about Â£3000 this year, and they gave Â£30 for a party under the chestnut tree to celebrate VE Day. The Pimperne Parish Council wants Five Ways to be made more safe. Pimperne has changed over the last 20 years,lots more houses have been built.The Council do not want any more built,the village is big enough.
